Race.SummaryText:
Bayou Mallet and Plaquemine Gravity Drainage District No. 10 Propositions 
Proposition No. 1 
(Bond)
Race.FullText: Shall Bayou Mallet and Plaquemine Gravity Drainage District No. 10 of St. Landry Parish, Louisiana (the "District"), incur debt and issue bonds not exceeding $580,000, in one or more series, to run not exceeding 10 years from date thereof, with interest not exceeding 8% per annum, for the purpose of constructing, improving and maintaining gravity drainage works within and for the District, including Bayou Plaquemine, Bayou Mallet and their laterals located within the District, which bonds will be general obligations of the District payable from ad valorem taxes to be levied and collected in the manner provided by Article VI, Section 33 of the Constitution of the State of Louisiana of 1974 and statutory authority supplemental thereto, with no estimated increase in the millage rate to be levied in the first year of issue above the 5.33 mills currently being levied to pay General Obligation Bonds of the District?

Race.SummaryText:
Bayou Mallet and Plaquemine Gravity Drainage District No. 10 Propositions
Proposition No. 2 
(Millage Continuation)
Race.FullText: Shall Bayou Mallet and Plaquemine Gravity Drainage District No. 10 of St. Landry Parish, Louisiana (the "District''), continue to levy a special tax of twelve and nineteen hundredths (12.19) mills on all property subject to taxation in the District (an estimated $162,600 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2015 and ending with the year 2024, for the purpose of constructing, maintaining, operating and improving the gravity drainage works in the District, said millage to represent a two and nineteen hundredths mills (2.19) increase over the 10 mills tax authorized to be levied through the year 2014 pursuant to an election held on July 16, 2005?
